line_1: So when full Ears scarce hold the ripen'd Grains,
line_2: And of rude Gales the whisp'ring Field complains,

line_1: Press'd by the cumbrous weight of single Grains.
line_2: They strain, they labour with incessant Pains

line_1: "HENCE glows, refulgent Tin! thy chrystal grains,
line_2: And tawny Copper shoots her azure veins;

line_1: He munches now the steaming grains,
line_2: Now with full swill the liquor drains;

line_1: Draw down their windy Eggs, and pilfer'd Grains;
line_2: And when they conscious scent the gath'ring Rains,
